channel.title: Help with custom items
channel.description:
I have read just about every topic in this category and i cant find anywhere about adding your own items tut or anything i created my own server about 1 to 2 yrs ago but its change a bit. I can edit shops and everything else but when i edit the items and then put in my bank it locks it up. Cant figure it out i have tried to ask some old friends but here is my error message
Buildfile: build.xml
runclient: [java] Session ID: -3583995170381693854 - Login Response:0 [java] Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.NullPointerException [java] at org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.drawBankBox(mudclient.java:108 7) [java] at org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.drawGameWindowsMenus(mudclient .java:6307) [java] at org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.drawGame(mudclient.java:2300) [java] at org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.method4(mudclient.java:848) [java] at org.rscdaemon.client.GameWindow.run(GameWindow.java:282) [java] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
I edited the items.xml in the client and in the server and also i changed the itemwieldable.def
itemwieldable.def --------
<entry> <int>1328</int> <ItemWieldableDef> <sprite>53</sprite> <type>8216</type> <wieldPos>4</wieldPos> <armourPoints>24</armourPoints> <weaponAimPoints>150</weaponAimPoints> <weaponPowerPoints>71</weaponPowerPoints> <magicPoints>0</magicPoints> <prayerPoints>9</prayerPoints> <rangePoints>0</rangePoints> <requiredStats> </requiredStats> <femaleOnly>false</femaleOnly> </ItemWieldableDef> </entry>
itemdef.xml on server ------ <ItemDef> <name>Rune 2-handed Sword</name> <description>A very large sword</description> <command></command> <sprite>82</sprite> <basePrice>64000</basePrice> <stackable>false</stackable> <wieldable>true</wieldable> <pictureMask>65535</pictureMask> </ItemDef>
Items.rscd ------------
<ItemDef> <name>Rune 2-handed Sword</name> <description>A very large sword</description> <command></command> <sprite>82</sprite> <basePrice>64000</basePrice> <stackable>false</stackable> <wieldable>true</wieldable> <pictureMask>65535</pictureMask> </ItemDef>
Anyone have suggestion or can tell me what i did wrong. I thought it was simple enough to do cause i have done it before

item.title: Help with custom items
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Problem fixed. If you need anymore help magnum, message me on MSN

Read full topic

item.title: Help with custom items
item.dc:creator: @magnum magnum
item.description:
@magnum wrote:

i editted the name of the server and stuff but thats it like i said the server runs fine till i change the items

Read full topic

item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Have you edited anything in the mudclient.java?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with custom items
item.dc:creator: @magnum magnum
item.description:
@magnum wrote:

I have read just about every topic in this category and i cant find anywhere about adding your own items tut or anything i created my own server about 1 to 2 yrs ago but its change a bit. I can edit shops and everything else but when i edit the items and then put in my bank it locks it up. Cant figure it out i have tried to ask some old friends but here is my error message

Buildfile: build.xml

runclient:
[java] Session ID: -3583995170381693854 - Login Response:0
[java] Exception in thread “Thread-3” java.lang.NullPointerException
[java] at org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.drawBankBox(mudclient.java:108
7)
[java] at org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.drawGameWindowsMenus(mudclient
.java:6307)

[java] at org.rscdaemon.client.GameWindow.run(GameWindow.java:282)
[java] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

I edited the items.xml in the client and in the server and also i changed the itemwieldable.def

itemwieldable.def --------

1328 53 8216 4 24 150 71 0 9 0 false

itemdef.xml on server ------

Rune 2-handed Sword
A very large sword

82
64000
false
true
65535

Items.rscd ------------

Rune 2-handed Sword A very large sword 82 64000 false true 65535

Anyone have suggestion or can tell me what i did wrong. I thought it was simple enough to do cause i have done it before
